ideas.name: AI Assessment Factory
ideas.summary: SaaS tool generating Part 145-aligned assessments with Patty Shank quality
ideas.target: A&P schools, repair stations, corporate training

ideas.name: Ancestor Stories Platform
ideas.summary: Genealogy + AI narratives. Upload GEDCOM → get Ken Burns-style stories

ideas.name: Meditation App
ideas.summary: Headspace-style guided meditations + timers. Nick keeps coming back to this idea.
ideas.notes: Recurring idea - Nick thinks about this often. Someday/maybe bucket.

ideas.name: Course-in-a-Box Engine
ideas.summary: Drop raw technical content → get complete training package (lessons, assessments, labs)

ideas.name: Personal Otterbot
ideas.summary: Personal AI that joins meetings, transcribes everything, extracts action items/names/decisions automatically. Your own Otter.ai but customized to YOUR context and projects.
ideas.notes: Nick's idea - triggered by the memory/capture problem. Real pain point.

ideas.name: GEDCOM Tree Cleaner
ideas.summary: Upload GEDCOM → app cleans/organizes it, charts what records exist per ancestor (census, birth, marriage, death, military), shows what's MISSING. Gap analysis for genealogy.
ideas.target: Genealogy enthusiasts, family historians, Ancestry/FamilySearch users
features: Chart existing records (census, vital, military, etc.)
Suggestions for next records to find
Cool UI: animated tree being pruned/cleaned while processing
ideas.notes: Nick's 5:26 AM idea. Visual of tree being cleaned is the hook.

ideas.name: Myst-Style Detective Game
ideas.summary: Text-based detective mystery game with atmospheric audio. Interview witnesses, search for clues, solve cases. Scene-based with immersive soundscapes (cafe chatter, glasses clinking, rain, etc.)
ideas.target: Gamers, puzzle lovers, interactive fiction fans
ideas.notes: Nick's late night idea. The audio atmosphere is the key differentiator - makes text feel alive.

nicks_inspirations.description: Instead of 1:1 with each persona, have them debate as a panel while Nick watches and jumps in. Personas talk to EACH OTHER, not just to Nick. Makes brainstorming feel like a boardroom, not an interrogation.
